about_section.description: At SmachStack, we’re a global technology partner empowering businesses across North America, Europe, and beyond with future-ready solutions in web development, mobile applications, AI, and embedded systems. With a team averaging over 10 years of experience—including top AI specialists and DevOps architects—we bring precision to projects ranging from safety-critical systems to scalable enterprise platforms. Strategically located in UK and Pakistan, our globally connected teams combine technical mastery with a client-first approach, delivering technology that solves complex challenges while driving growth. Let’s build what’s next—together.

case_studies_hero.title: Case Studies
case_studies_hero.description: Discover how our technology solutions have propelled businesses to new heights. Through collaboration, innovation, and a tailored approach, we’ve helped our clients overcome complex challenges, streamline operations, and unlock new opportunities for growth.

case_study_cards.title: Building a Cloud-Based BI System
case_study_cards.description: We created a roaming analytics solution with the most comprehensive features in the market for Yaana, a worldwide provider of smart compliance and national security solutions.
case_study_cards.content:
Yaana Technologies had the possibility to become a leader in the European market, but their newly acquired legacy system didn't let the company meet its ambitious goal. The desktop solution had some important limitations that prevented the company’s growth. For example, it was impossible to create deals, compare several budgets or work in parallel. Rigid architecture and the lack of functionality blocked Yaana from attracting global clients such as Orange Group, a multinational telecom corporation.

## The Challenge

The client was facing issues with a traditional monolithic CMS.  
Content updates were slow, scaling required heavy infrastructure investment, and the frontend performance was not meeting user expectations.  
They needed a modern stack that could handle dynamic product updates while delivering a fast and engaging shopping experience.

To acquire the world’s leading enterprises, Yaana needed to switch from the desktop NeuString system to a web-based solution and enhance the existing functionality specifically for mobile operator groups. To achieve it, they reached out to Flyaps. 

## Exceptional calculation skills and focus on UX


To build telecom solutions – or any tech-driven products – you need two things: implementing the features that fully respond to the clients’ needs and creating an interface that would deliver a seamless experience. At Flyaps, we do both: with a focus on user-centered interfaces and advanced functionality, we are able to implement the most complex algorithms and wrap them in a sleek design that even non-tech users can understand.

![Team Working](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1667372283536-a832e74401c2?q=80&w=1632&auto=format&fit=crop&ixlib=rb-4.1.0&ixid=M3wxMjA3fDB8MHxwaG90by1wYWdlfHx8fGVufDB8fHx8fA%3D%3D)

---

## Seamless transition to a new system

Entirely replacing the legacy system means that all business processes will be disrupted. For the existing clients, it translates into inconveniences and delays that would impact their workflows. That’s why we suggested the evolutionary approach – instead of instantly switching off the old system, we decided to keep it while building a new solution and enabling access to both systems. Gradually replacing an old system with a new one, we avoided radical changes and disrupting the ongoing processes.

case_study_cards.title: Automating Business Processes to Speed Up Project Delivery
case_study_cards.description: Smach Stack created a custom CRM/ERP solution for a leading telecom consulting firm. Automating their back-office processes and streamlining calculations for suitable tariff plans for clients.
case_study_cards.content:
NetSpark IP & Telecom provides two types of services – wireline engagement and mobility engagement. 
Wireline engagement involves configuring network equipment and IT infrastructure for various organizations. For instance, they may enhance mobile network coverage in metro stations or install GPS tracking systems for delivery companies.

## We know telecom, so we fit the bill
Our team has significant experience in the telecom industry and understands the specific details of tariff plans, including discounts, special offers, and more. We know that accuracy is crucial in this field. NetSpark was seeking a partner with these qualities, and we were the perfect fit.

![Team Working](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1669023414162-5bb06bbff0ec?q=80&w=1632&auto=format&fit=crop&ixlib=rb-4.1.0&ixid=M3wxMjA3fDB8MHxwaG90by1wYWdlfHx8fGVufDB8fHx8fA%3D%3D)

## Collaborative business process mapping
During the discovery phase, we collaborated with the leaders of various company departments to perform business process mapping and create tech specifications. We analyzed the client’s business requirements and converted them into technical tasks for our engineers. Once the technical documentation was ready, we got down to software development.

## Developing custom CRM/ERP software
Since our client didn’t have in-house technical experts, the software development process was entirely on us. We used Python (Django), React, and Material UI for fast and cost-effective product development. Our DevOps engineer set up CI/CD pipelines to automate the release process so that we could deliver high-quality builds frequently.

case_study_cards.title: Setting Up DevOps Infrastructure on AWS
case_study_cards.description: Global talent-matching platform, faced scalability issues due to its outdated infrastructure and turned to Smach Stack for help. We moved their system from a legacy setup to a modern, scalable platform powered by Kubernetes on AWS.
case_study_cards.content:
TechHire is a leading talent-matching platform that connects employers with over 50,000 vetted candidates from 500+ top agencies in Latin America and Europe. Founded in 2014, TechHire quickly became a global hit and surpassed $1 million in sales within two years without any external investment. It was shortly accepted by a well-known American venture fund for promising startups.

The secret behind TechHire’s success is that it offers a safe and stress-free solution to the common problem of team scaling. Here’s how it works: the TechHire platform features developer profiles from the software development agencies that passed TechHire's multistep vetting process. Clients set up a quick call with one of the Matching Experts at TechHire, build a candidate list, and conduct pre-interviews to ensure the candidates perfectly fit their needs. Finally, they sign a contract with the chosen talent. TechHire provides a 1-month free trial and candidate replacements if needed.

As their customer base grew, TechHire faced the scalability problem. Their legacy platform's internal issues prevented it from scaling, impacting performance, time to market, and deployment speed. To solve this problem, TechHire reached out to CodeWorks for ongoing support and DevOps services.

Read on to learn how we overhauled the platform’s architecture and allowed TechHire to evolve their platform further, taking full control of their solution.

## The need for a complete infrastructure overhaul

Before starting the project, our team conducted a thorough DevOps assessment to identify the root cause of the problem and come up with the best strategy to tackle it. We discovered that the key issue was the chaotic infrastructure that had already reached a dead-end level and started to tamper with the development pace and time-to-market.

Another key problem was that the platform was at constant risk of data loss, as there was no backup storage or plan B in case of a system crash.

case_study_cards.title: Developing an AI-based Resume Screening Chrome Extension
case_study_cards.description: We helped an HR technology startup create a smart plugin that optimizes the process of resume screening.
case_study_cards.content:
## Project highlights

Built an AI-based Chrome extension that analyzes resumes and provides definitions of IT terms

Implemented a natural language processing algorithm to correctly extract critical data

Created our own tokenizer to speed up the analysis and enhance the accuracy

## Chrome extension to automatically analyze and evaluate candidate CVs

The IT industry is developing at an insane pace. EJB, JSF, JPA, JBoss – new libraries and tools emerge every month, creating new tech terms. This makes candidate screening a complicated process – even for experienced recruiters, it becomes more and more difficult to keep all the technical terms in mind.

This is why GlossaryTech was built – the extension is designed to help recruitment managers with the resume screening process. Within seconds of analyzing a web page, this tool automatically sorts the technologies mentioned by a developer, highlights them in the resume, and provides their definitions. This significantly simplifies and speeds up the process for recruiters to evaluate whether a candidate is suitable for the role.

## Implementing an NLP algorithm to correctly extract critical data

The main challenge in automatic text analysis is developing an algorithm capable of extracting crucial data and accurately interpreting it. Algorithms may miss important information because of unstructured documents and variations in meaning. With tech terms, the data analysis becomes even harder – for example, how do you define if the word "go" used in a developer's resume is a verb or a programming language?

To tackle these challenges, we developed an NLP algorithm that uses our tech glossary as a reference to precisely comprehend the meaning and context of language. By relying on machine learning, NLP can quickly identify the necessary information and categorize it correctly, thus expediting the resume screening process.

## Building our own tokenizer for faster analysis of multi-word expressions

Although open-source libraries can work great in certain cases, they don’t allow full control over the analyzing process. To make GlossaryTech faster and more accurate in terms of data extraction, we decided to build our own tokenizer.

This tokenizer is designed for general purpose and works perfectly for the ICT domain. It is optimized for identifying particular entities or phrases, and it performs well not only with single words but also with multi-word phrases, such as "Ruby on Rails".

news_blogs_and_event.title: News Blogs & Events
news_blogs_and_event.description: We love reading, researching, and writing a lot of stuff about technology, current trends, and other technology-related things. Explore our writings where we have shared our technological insights.

news_items.title: Python for Automation: How It Can Help Your Business Work Efficiently
news_items.author: John Smith
news_items.content:
Running a business often means dealing with the same repetitive tasks every day including updating spreadsheets, preparing reports, sending reminders, replying to emails, and much more. While these tasks are important, they also take away valuable time that could be spent on strategy, customers, and growth. 

From automated code generation to personalized user experiences, AI is becoming a powerful tool in web development.

---

## Why Businesses Need Automation

These tasks are not only time-consuming but also prone to human error. Over time, they add hidden costs and slow down business operations and growth. 

Automation can take over these repetitive tasks in the background, freeing up your team to focus on serving customers and scaling your business.

![AI Concept](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1518770660439-4636190af475?w=800&auto=format&fit=crop&q=80)


---

##  Top Reasons to Use Python for Automation

The integration of AI with cloud platforms is another important advancement.  
Cloud providers now offer AI-driven services that allow businesses to scale smarter while reducing infrastructure costs.


---

##  The Benefits You Can Expect with Python Automation

Frameworks like Next.js, combined with headless CMS solutions like Strapi, are making it easier to integrate AI-driven APIs.  
Developers can now build scalable, SEO-friendly websites while leveraging the power of machine learning models.
news_items.description: This article explores how automation and AI are transforming business operations by reducing repetitive tasks, minimizing errors, and freeing teams to focus on growth.

news_items.title: ERP Logistics Integration: Benefits and Industry Use Cases
news_items.author: John Smith
news_items.content:
Running a logistics or supply chain business today is no easy job. Delays, inefficiencies, miscommunication between departments, and lack of real-time visibility can slow everything down from order processing to delivery.

Many businesses try to fix these issues by using software, but often, the systems don’t talk to each other. You might be using one tool for logistics and another for managing inventory, finance, or sales. Without proper connection, these tools create silos leading to slow updates, data duplication, and poor decision-making.

---

## What ERP and Logistics Software Do? 

### Common challenges include:

ERP software helps manage your core business functions such as inventory, procurement, finance, sales, HR, and more. It brings different departments together by organizing data in one place and keeping everything in sync.

Logistics software focuses on the day-to-day movement of goods. It manages transportation, warehousing, order tracking, and shipping, helping your team handle deliveries and stock more efficiently.

---

## What Happens When ERP and Logistics Software Work Together?

- Your sales team closes an order, but the warehouse doesn’t get the update immediately.  
- Inventory levels don’t sync in real time, leading to stockouts or overstocking.  
- Shipping teams don’t get accurate order details, which leads to delivery delays.  

When these tasks are handled through paper files, messages, and scattered spreadsheets, things slip through the cracks.  

---

## What is ERP-Logistics Integration?

![ERP Logistics](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1484417894907-623942c8ee29?q=80&w=1632&auto=format&fit=crop&ixlib=rb-4.1.0&ixid=M3wxMjA3fDB8MHxwaG90by1wYWdlfHx8fGVufDB8fHx8fA%3D%3D)

ERP-logistics integration means connecting your logistics management software with your Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system so that information can move freely between them without delays or manual entry. It brings your entire operation onto one platform, where every department can access real-time, accurate data.
news_items.description: Logistics and supply chain businesses face delays, inefficiencies, and poor visibility when systems don’t connect.

news_items.title: What Is Custom Software Development & How It Differs From Off-the-Shelf Solutions
news_items.author: John Smith
news_items.content:
Every business today uses software in some way whether it’s to manage their work, serve their customers, or run daily operations. But when it comes to choosing the right software, one common question comes up:

## What Is Custom Software Development?

Custom software is made specifically for your business. Instead of using a general solution that’s built for everyone, custom software is designed to match the way your company works. It’s like tailoring a suit to fit your body instead of buying one off the rack. 

Let’s say you run a growing delivery business. You may want software that matches your delivery routes, tracks your drivers in real-time, handles customer feedback, and sends custom alerts. Off-the-shelf software may not offer all of this. That’s where custom software development comes in and builds exactly what you need.

![Cloud Servers](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1463171379579-3fdfb86d6285?q=80&w=1170&auto=format&fit=crop&ixlib=rb-4.1.0&ixid=M3wxMjA3fDB8MHxwaG90by1wYWdlfHx8fGVufDB8fHx8fA%3D%3D)

---

## What Are Off-the-Shelf Solutions?

Off-the-shelf software (also called ready-made or commercial software) is created for a broad audience. It comes with fixed features and is ready to install and use.

These solutions are often well-tested, quick to deploy, and relatively low-cost in the beginning. But they come with limitations. You can’t change much, and you often end up adjusting your workflow to match the software instead of the other way around.
news_items.description: Every business today uses software in some way whether it’s to manage their work, serve their customers, or run daily operations.

news_items.title: How AI Solves Real Business Problems and Pain Points: Top 10 Use Cases
news_items.author: John Smith
news_items.content:
You have to deal with growing competition, rising costs, changing customer needs, and a fast-moving market. On top of that, you’re expected to make quick decisions, keep customers happy, and be at the top of the game.  
AI (Artificial Intelligence) is the answer to all these problems.
AI (Artificial Intelligence) is the answer to all these problems.
Lately, at Softices, we’re seeing more and more businesses coming to us for AI-based solutions. Why? Because AI helps solve real business problems faster, cheaper, and smarter.

---

## Practical Use Cases Where Artificial Intelligence (AI) Delivers Real Business Value

Businesses today rely heavily on digital transformation.  

### 1. Customer Service & Support
Customer support teams are overwhelmed. As your business grows, so do the number of queries, complaints, and requests. Responding to everyone on time becomes tough, especially with a small team or outside business hours.  
From startups to large enterprises, cloud platforms are the backbone of modern innovation.

![Cloud Servers](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1499750310107-5fef28a66643?q=80&w=1170&auto=format&fit=crop&ixlib=rb-4.1.0&ixid=M3wxMjA3fDB8MHxwaG90by1wYWdlfHx8fGVufDB8fHx8fA%3D%3D)

---

## Why More Businesses Are Turning to AI Now
Until recently, only big companies (tech giants or research labs) had the resources to explore AI. Today, even small and medium-sized businesses are using AI tools to save time, cut costs, and make better use of their resources.
 
Most modern AI tools are designed to work with your existing website, CRM, or business system. You don’t need to rebuild everything from scratch.
news_items.description: AI is transforming how businesses handle competition, costs, and customer demands by offering smarter, faster, and more affordable solutions.

news_items.title: Property Management Software for Small Landlords and Businesses
news_items.author: John Smith
news_items.content:
If you are a small landlord, you probably know how much time and effort it takes to manage even a few properties. From finding tenants and collecting rent to handling repairs and keeping track of accounts, the work never seems to end.

---

## Challenges Small Landlords Often Face

## Common challenges include:

- **Late rent payments:** Chasing bank transfers or cheques takes time and delays cash flow.  
- **Tenant screening issues:** Checking references and backgrounds manually can be slow and leave room for risky tenants.  
- **Maintenance delays:** Calls and texts from tenants can get missed or forgotten.  
- **Accounting errors:** Spreadsheets are easy to update incorrectly, leading to financial mistakes.  
- **Legal risks:** Missing a compliance requirement or local regulation can result in fines.  

---

## Day-to-day tasks often include:

- Listing properties and managing inquiries  
- Screening and approving tenants  
- Drafting and signing rental agreements  
- Collecting rent and sending reminders  
- Tracking maintenance requests and follow-ups  
- Recording expenses and generating financial reports  

---

When these tasks are handled through paper files, messages, and scattered spreadsheets, things slip through the cracks.  

Property management software keeps everything in one secure, easy-to-use system. You can track tasks, store records, communicate with tenants, and manage finances, all from one place so you spend less time chasing updates and more time focusing on your rental business.


![Cloud Servers](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1526666923127-b2970f64b422?w=500&auto=format&fit=crop&q=60&ixlib=rb-4.1.0&ixid=M3wxMjA3fDB8MHxzZWFyY2h8NTV8fHRlY2hub2xvZ3l8ZW58MHx8MHx8fDA%3D)

---

## What is Property Management Software?

Property management software is a tool that helps landlords, property owners, and managers handle all the tasks involved in renting out properties but in a simpler, more organised way.

Instead of using multiple apps, paper files, and manual processes, you get a single platform where you can:

- **Advertise and showcase your properties**  
- **Screen tenants faster:** Run credit and background checks in minutes.  
- **Manage leases digitally:** Store and sign documents online.  
- **Collect rent online:** Tenants pay automatically, reducing late payments.  
- **Track maintenance:** Tenants submit requests through an app, and you can assign repair jobs.  
- **Generate financial reports:** See income, expenses, and tax-ready statements.
news_items.description: Managing rental properties is time-consuming, with challenges like late payments, tenant screening, and maintenance delays.

news_items.title: Android Jetpack Compose: Modern UI Toolkit for Android Development
news_items.author: John Smith
news_items.content:
Jetpack Compose is Android’s modern UI toolkit designed to simplify and accelerate the process of building native Android user interfaces. Unlike traditional Android UI development, which relies heavily on XML layouts and imperative code (like findViewById or RecyclerView.Adapter), Jetpack Compose allows you to build UI declaratively using Kotlin.

---

## Why Choose Jetpack Compose Over XML-Based UI?

###  1. Declarative UI: Write What the UI Should Be

Compose lets you describe how your UI should look based on the app’s current state. When data changes, the UI automatically updates, similar to frameworks like React or Flutter.


###  2 . Less Boilerplate, More Productivity
No separate XML files or binding classes.
UI and business logic live together in Kotlin code, making it easier to read and maintain.

![Cloud Servers](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1498050108023-c5249f4df085?w=600&auto=format&fit=crop&q=60&ixlib=rb-4.1.0&ixid=M3wxMjA3fDB8MHxzZWFyY2h8MjV8fHRlY2hub2xvZ3l8ZW58MHx8MHx8fDA%3D)

---
news_items.description: Jetpack Compose is Google’s modern UI toolkit for Android, enabling developers to build responsive, declarative UIs with less code.
